question: Is the device free of any dirt/contamination?
details: Inspect ophthalmoscope for external cracks, damage and dirt.

question: Clean device using cloth moistened with alcohol.
details: Examine the device for dirt and contamination. See BTA skills on Mechanical Cleaning.

question: Does the light bulb power on with battery?
details: Power on the device with battery. Examine whether light bulb gives sufficient illumination.

question: Rotate the aperture dial so they are not in- between positions.
details: Aperture dial can be in-between positions.

question: Recharge battery if applicable or replace it.
details: Refer BTA skill set on Batteries to identify and replace damaged batteries.

question: Replace bulb if necessary.
details: Refer BTA skill set on Lighting/Indicators to replace non-functional light bulbs.

question: Inspect and fix broken wires or bad connections between battery and bulb.
details: Inspect wires and connections from battery to bulb using multimeter. Refer BTA skill set on Connections for identifying and fixing broken wires and bad connections.

question: Clean lenses with cotton swab.
details: Clean lenses to remove any dirt and contamination. See BTA skills on Mechanical Cleaning.

question: Are the lenses and mirror free from cracks/defects?
details: Any defect in the lenses and mirror will not provide a clear view.

question: Replace lenses and mirror if necessary.
details: Replace lenses and mirror if necessary. Identify and replace with a suitable lens to get a clear view.

question: Does the device provide a sharp focus and free from any glare?
details: The lenses and mirror are dirty.

question: Perform preventive maintenance on ophthalmoscope. Return device to clinical personnel.
details: Ophthalmoscope is working properly. Perform preventive maintenance before returning the device to clinical personnel.

question: Clean lenses and mirror with cotton swab.
details: Clean lenses and mirror to remove any dirt and contamination.
